article_node.title: Federal agents conduct apparent raid outside Newsom event in Los Angeles
article_node.summary: California Governor Gavin Newsom announced a special election for mid-decade redistricting to counter Republican efforts in Texas and other states to redraw congressional maps favoring their party. This announcement coincided with federal immigration enforcement patrols in Los Angeles, which Mayor Karen Bass criticized as a provocative act aimed at undermining Newsom's press conference. The redistricting efforts in states like Texas, Florida, and Ohio could potentially yield Republicans nine additional seats in the House, while Democrats face challenges in states with independent commissions controlling the map-drawing process.
